creator: shopov.bogomil

content:
Hi! Thanks for your answer, unfortunately these are exactly the notifications I mentioned which I tend to miss because they neither require any interaction before vanishing nor play an alarm sound. So TB distinguishes between those soft alerts called "Notifications" and the hard alerts called "Reminders", and I'd like to have reminders.

However, I spent some time today to write a python script using the icalendar package. It adds an alarm to any event in my calendar which doesn't have one activated and is called once per hour by the windows task scheduler. This was the easiest way for me since I have direct access to the calendar file. Only some trouble getting the scheduler to work with a silent python script, but it worked out in the end. :)

Still would be great if the TB calendar in the future would be extended by a global option for "hard alerts" - Reminders. I also couldn't find any add-ons aiming in that direction. I guess this has not been done yet as the alerts are part of the ical file format (VALARM) and the TB notifications are just some internal functionality. So maybe just extend this notification function by options for a window demanding dismission and/or playing a sound.

Thank you nevertheless!
creator: trashmaster

content:
The Ctrl-Shift-J command doesn't bring up the error console in this version of Thunderbird.

So what happens when you press Ctrl-Shift-J? It certainly brings up the Error Console here with TB 115.9.0.

I just tried changing my TLS version from 3 (apparently set by the latest Thunderbird update) to 1 in the Config. Editor.

I'd not mess with TLS settings unless you know exactly what you're doing.

My reference to Verizon was due to the fact that I can no longer count on Comcast to provide me with a certificate that Thunderbird will accept

The screenshot with the error message you posted is not very specific. So it's too early to blame Verizon for using a bad certificate. Is that the only error you get? I'd expect more information in the Error Console

If you feel like to request Verizon to update their certificate - good luck with that.

I'm still not sure though why you're first talking about Comcast, and then mix in Verizon.

Also I'm wondering why there are more than 10 Comcast SMTP servers set up in your Thunderbird profile (3rd screenshot).

content:
I am posting this just in case anyone else runs into a similar issue.

I found a partial answer yesterday, after a lot of searching, here: https://support.mozilla.org/zh-CN/questions/1216846 RE: "Q1. Where are my Sent emails - would they be mixed in with received messages in each yearly archive?" YES RE: "Q2. How do I access these sent emails within the TB search window?" Changing the headings in the mail list to show From instead of Correspondents. You then look for your own email address to see what you sent. Clunky, but doable. There are probably better ways of doing this.

Interesting - 25 views so far, but no one had any suggestions? A bit disappointing TBH.

Stu.

content:
Seriously, the very first thing you choose in the new account wizard is the choice of IMAP Vs POP if Thunderbird finds both settings, for example looking in the database here https://autoconfig.thunderbird.net/v1.1/. Or using its probes.

Diagnostics have to be enabled, failure that requires them should not be normal in the first place. https://wiki.mozilla.org/MailNews:Logging

Otherwise if it does not find anything it drops you into the manual settings with the yellow banner that it can not find the settings for your email account.

So perhaps we can back up a little here, because I simple don't think you should need to be "fixing" encryption protocols on a production server. Anything using a version of TLS like one is in the realms of Luddites. TLS version one was replaced with a newer version in 2008. Just like not fiddling with unsupported SSL which in reality was obsolete in the last century. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transport_Layer_Security

These sorts of low level security issues can be observed to be the issue in the error console (ctrl+shift+J). No one should just change them in the config editor and see what happens.

I would suggest you try offering details of the domain these accounts function under. Especially so if it is self hosted for through a hosting service as they have all sorts of special requirements depending on the service. Perhaps the results of attempts without antivirus products interfering.
creator: MattAuSupport
